verses.roman:
takṣakaḥ prahito viprāḥ
kruddhena dvija-sūnunā
hantu-kāmo nṛpaṁ gacchan
dadarśa pathi kaśyapam

synonyms: takṣakaḥ—the snake-bird Takṣaka; prahitaḥ—sent; viprāḥ—O learned brāhmaṇas; kruddhena—who had been angered; dvija—of the sage Samīka; sūnunā—by the son; hantu-kāmaḥ—desirous of killing; nṛpam—the King; gacchan—while going; dadarśa—he saw; pathi—upon the road; kaśyapam—Kaśyapa Muni.
translation: O learned brāhmaṇas, the snake-bird Takṣaka, who had been sent by the angry son of a brāhmaṇa, was going toward the King to kill him when he saw Kaśyapa Muni on the path.
